Rockville.Congressional Airport:
Congressional Airport was a 40-acre (16 ha) airfield, located in what is now Rockville, Maryland, just outside Washington, D.C., used for the Civilian Pilot Training Program.


== History ==


=== Opening ===
Congressional Airport opened in 1928, intended for commercial flying service and a training school. At the time, the location of the airport was called Halpine, Maryland; the area was later annexed by the City of Rockville.
